Dummy Modules¶

The file src/test_modules.py contains classes that should only be used in testing. The modules SenseHat and PiCamera are built to be run on a RaspberryPi with the correct hardware attached. However, we wanted to be able to run and test the program on a laptop during the development process. Therefore this file supplies dummy methods and functions to let the main processes work as if these devices were connected by returning random data in the correct format.

class src.test_modules.SenseHat¶

Simulates the functions from the SenseHat module by supplying random data. Allows the program to run in a testing environment.

get_accelerometer_raw() → tuple¶

Generates simulated accelerometer data

get_gyroscope_raw() → tuple¶

Generates simulated gyroscope data

load_image(file_path, redraw=True)¶

Simulates loading an image into the LED matrix. Actually does nothing

class src.test_modules.PiCamera(resolution: tuple = (640, 480))¶

Simulates the functions from the PiCamera module by supplying mimic data in place of real input. Allows the program to run in a testing environment.

Parameters

resolution – A tuple with the width and height of the image to request

capture(output: numpy.ndarray, *args, **kwargs)¶

Simulates getting an image output from the onboard camera.

Works by requesting a random image from the website https://picsum.photos.

Parameters

output – A numpy array with the same dimensions as the image requested
